snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''Women Move Closer to Olympic Equality'' (front page, Aug. 20):    Title IX, which bans sex discrimination in federally financed programs, opened many doors to American women and girls in sports, but its promise has only begu...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Women Move Closer to Olympic Equality'' (front page, Aug. 20): Title IX, which bans sex discrimination in federally financed programs, opened many doors to American women and girls in sports, but its promise has only begun to be realized.
abstract: California Women's Law Center executive director Abby J Feibman letter, prompted by Aug 20 article on women moving closer to Olympic equality, asks how glory of Olympic Games can co-exist with discrimination that has occurred against women athletes in California; drawing

headline.main: On the Playing Field, Boys Still Go First
